Used his own buddy's body to cover him from the friendly napalm strikes! (This actually happened in the Vietnam war)

Hell yeah
The beacon was lit half way thru October. Seeing Christmas shit like jack skellington in Christmas land.. what's this!

Those were the days
And I didn't even scan the Xbox or PlayStation
Nerd!

item.title: Go travel to flyover states and you’ll get it
item.description: Save the technicalities for the debate competition, I’m calling them flyover states because that’s exactly what they are. Drive through those states (no one fucking flies to them except puddle hoppers) and you’ll see exactly why they would cheer for the destruction of the capitol, and why we are in deeper trouble than we assumed. I drove through Oklahoma, Missouri, Illinois and Indiana over the weekend on interstate highways, and I saw a dozen or so confederate flags on barns and ranches. (I’ve done this exact drive for about 5 years now, and the number of places I feel safe to stop have definitely decreased). I saw more than 1 electronic sign blaming the democrats for the shutdown, in Oklahoma. My favorite sign is from Indiana that claims “no feed because democrat shutdown”, (I’m guessing they mean food for livestock) But I digress, my point being that some of them genuinely see themselves as saviors of America, they draw comparisons to revolutionaries who are destroying the evil govt from the inside. Thats why they see no issues with critiquing the government even when they control pretty much every lever, they are there to destroy it. The govt is currently a hindrance, it’s a safe guard against the their idea of America which is a Christo Fascist state. Destroying the capital means nothing to people who already see it as the Death Star, these are not intelligent people we’re dealing with here. (This was supposed to be a longer rant but I’m no longer is Texas and don’t feel that rant-y, yet. For now I’m a bit too glad to be out of that hell hole)

item.title: Trump's Great Gatsby Party // Behind the meaning. Most things these people do they do to troll their own supporters.
item.description: In The Great Gatsby, Nick Carraway serves as the moral lens through which readers witness the corruption and excess of the wealthy. At first, he is enchanted by the glamour of East Egg, the fictional community representing America’s old-money elite who live in comfort and arrogance across the bay from Gatsby’s mansion. The glittering lights, laughter, and illusion of sophistication draw him in, but as he observes deceit, carelessness, and moral decay, his admiration turns into disgust. By the novel’s end, Nick retreats to the Midwest, disillusioned with a world that confuses wealth for worth. The modern public, too, has become a kind of collective Nick Carraway, once drawn in by the promises of success, freedom, and prosperity, only to discover the emptiness behind the spectacle. Watching a leader celebrate opulence in a Floridian palace while citizens queue for bread mirrors Nick’s awakening: the realization that the dream has been hollowed out, replaced by performance, greed, and indifference. The public’s disillusionment, like Nick’s, is not just disappointment, it is a moral reckoning. The president’s Gatsby party that WoNt KiLl AnYBoDY is not merely a display of ignorance but a calculated act of domination, a performance meant to remind the disillusioned that their despair is part of the show. By recreating the world of Fitzgerald’s moral decay while his citizens suffer, he SNAPS their loss of faith into theater. The so-called hallowed party of conservatism becomes a symbol of mockery, a glittering taunt that says: your hunger feeds my power; your disillusionment is my entertainment. Just as the Buchanans retreated into their wealth after destroying others, this president uses spectacle to assert control, proving that in a society where the dream has died, the ruling class can still profit from the illusion. Everything they do, they do to mock you and America. Destroying the East-Wing? That was to destroy the building FDR built to combat fascism in America and abroad. It was to destroy the building that focused on defeating NAZISM, and combating the effects of a great depression. Franklin D. Roosevelt turned the White House’s East Terrace into the East Wing, building offices and workspaces that let him run the fight against fascism and Nazism. The new wing gave him room for staff, meetings, and communications, making it easier to keep track of global events, coordinate with allies, and plan America’s response to totalitarian threats. It wasn’t just an extension of the house, it was a command center for leading the country through some of the most dangerous years in world history. Eleanor Roosevelt, meanwhile, took over the East Wing in her own way, using it as a stage for activism and to push her progressive agenda. She held gatherings with journalists, politicians, and influential guests, but she didn’t treat them to fancy, indulgent meals. Instead, she served the plainest, cheapest food she could, modeled after what struggling Americans were eating during the Depression, making sure it was as bland and unappealing as possible. It was her sly way of mocking the wealthy, forcing them to sit through a meal that reminded them what ordinary people had to endure, all while she taught about frugality, empathy, and civic responsibility. Attempting to put everything she did into one paragraph is near impossible. They have a Great Gatsby party featuring exotic dancers while pushing fake christian moralities they don't have themselves, it's not by accident. They do this when Americans are starving. It's not an accident. They tear down the building used to defeat Nazis to build a ballroom so they can host parties and dance on the ground they've conquered from within. They did this by taking over a major party. Not creating a Nazi party. They took over a party. They didn't vote third party. They didn't ignore mid-term elections. They didn't say "primaries are pointless." A small amount of Nazis took control of your government by infiltrating a group of morally inept people. YOU CAN DO THE SAME EXACT THING. If you're not voting in mid-term elections--you're doing nothing. If you're not advocating for people in primaries you think are better--you're doing nothing. If you're not aiming for or helping someone obtain organizing positions within the DNC--you're doing nothing. Be smarter than nazis. https://www.militarytimes.com/veterans/military-history/2025/10/21/the-wwii-origins-of-the-now-demolished-east-wing-of-the-white-house/ https://www.history.com/articles/eleanor-roosevelt-first-lady-humanitarian-activist

item.title: Return of the Meme: 1514 (BlöödChëëp)
item.description:
Let's get this bread.
Woke up today with a mild, hopefully non-migraine headache from a dream I can't talk about because it would put me on a whole bunch of new, more threatening watch lists from the various letter organizations in the USA, so I'm going to leave it at that.
Honestly, would not mind being Star Trek energy being.
With SNAP not coming, I suppose it's a very good thing I got this tediously exhausting new job when I did.
When I learned about a month or so that Gambargin, one of my favorite historical shitposting artists/doodlists was going to be taking on some Mesoamerican stuff, I was stoked.
Me and who?
But now the Lions are gone.
Honestly, hot dogs or burgers over campfire coals hit 100% different.
Manuel I Komnenos failed because he had severe campaign ADHD and the defeat at Myriokephalon put the nail in the coffin.
Get in fuckers, we're going to do art.
Love anything Rosemary Rosco does.
Pippin tax. Note there is no escape. Today's message from Pippin: "Unbelievable! Pippin! Oh Pippin. Okay." ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin

“The lunatics end up in charge of everything. Sane, normal people don't need power trips.” - James P. Hogan I try to keep my posts "good vibe zones". So, instead of finding the one thing in here you don't like and commenting only on that, also comment about something you DID like. Balance the negativity. Love you long time. So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! You can now find it here https://discord.gg/qeCygcnWy8 - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work and pretty destitute. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've helped me so much. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me!

item.title: Recommend some great modern sci-fi (also fantasy and whatever)
item.description: I grew up with a lot of the classics, Asimov being a huge favorite. I've been spoiled by The Expanse - great decently-hard modern sci-fi with great writing. I'm creating this post in the hopes that y'all can recommend some great modern hard-ish sci-fi. Oh, another good series was the Miles Vorkosigan series. Last time I got this itch, I looked up the Hugo awards and… I really wasn't impressed. Some interesting ideas, but I guess I'm spoiled. :/ EDIT: 2024 Nebula winners, not Hugo. oops. On the fantasy front, I've liked some fantasy, but Discworld is what I've read so many times. I'm open to some fantasy suggestions, but at the moment, looking less for humour. On the random/other front, just taking any suggestions. I'd prefer modern stuff, but I'm open to whatever you're really enjoying. I will mention that a few years ago I tried Game of Thrones and it was just too violent even in book form for me to enjoy. I'm not good with violence/blood/gore so much. Although the Expanse is great about that, for example. I did read the Hunger Games books - all of them - and while I'm not fond of the violence, it's usually not too much for me to handle. So hey, I appreciate your book suggestions. I don't promise to read all of the books suggested, but I'll try to give most of them a try. <3 Of course, if this thread does take off, feel free to just post your favorite books since more people here means a wider variety of books would be appreciated. Definitely feel free (but not obligated) to give a good reason why you like a book or series, since that'll capture peoples' attentions. :) Also, if the thread does take off and you'd like me to, in a week or so, collect all the suggested books and publish the list, reply somewhere in here and when I do that, I'll tag ya. :)

item.title: GovBrief Today #276
item.description: Expect Trump to continue using multiple distractions to avoid the humanitarian crisis we face. One of every eight people has lost federal food aid while 5.9 million households are losing home heating aid just as we reach November. And the government said today that anyone traveling during this month's busy Thanksgiving week can expect extensive delays since half of the nation's air traffic centers are short staffed. That's why you're starting to hear about Trump invading Nigeria to defend the country's 100 million Christians. And he's ordered the military to blow up 16 boats he claimed were carrying drugs without offering proof. The UN called on America to stop, and his response was to blow up another vessel later to kill its inhabitants as well. He claims not to need Congress' permission to wage war in this way. Call your representatives today and make sure they start insisting that he does. After that, let's see if we can help our hungry, cold neighbors who have been abandoned by their government. Notice you're seeing less news on social media? We track the data - you're right. Social media networks are suppressing news stories more every day. Want to stop missing what matters? Get every brief in your inbox, 7 nights a week. Data, images, searchable archive. Free and private at govbrief.today. #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/heating-aid-shutdown [2] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-refuses-shutdown-negotiations [3] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-venezuela-war-doubtful [4] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-nigeria-invasion [5] https://go.govbrief.today/judge-blocks-guard-again [6] https://go.govbrief.today/wright-no-nuke-explosion [7] https://go.govbrief.today/bessent-maybe-snap-wednesday [8] https://go.govbrief.today/fed-furloughs-notices-sent [9] https://go.govbrief.today/duffy-flight-delays [10] https://go.govbrief.today/fda-top-official-resigns [11] https://go.govbrief.today/doj-monitoring-ca-voting Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com
